title: Former MP Mavai Senathirajah passes away
byline: Former Parliamentarian and senior leader of the Ilankai Thamil Arasu Katchchi (ITAK) Mavai Senathirajah has passes away at the age of 82.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says cloudy skies can be expected over Southern part of the island.

title: Trump signs order restricting gender care for young people
byline: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order aimed at restricting gender care for people under the age of 19.

title: Special discussion between President and trade union reps on upcoming budget
byline: A discussion was held between the trade unions affiliated with the National Trade Union Center and the President regarding the upcoming budget and the government’s economic program.

title: Laugfs Gas to provide relief to consumers in February
byline: Despite fluctuations in global gas prices, Laugfs Gas PLC says that steps will be taken to provide maximum relief to consumers in February.

title: Compensation for flood-damaged crops to begin today
byline: The Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board says that providing compensation for farmers whose crops were affected by the floods in November last year will commence today (30).

title: ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ program must be implemented with humanitarian objectives – PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has underscored the importance of implementing the “Clean Sri Lanka” program with humanitarian objectives at its core.

title: Shooting attempt reported in Maha Induruwa
byline: A shooting attempt took place in front of a house in the Maha Induruwa area of the Kosgoda Police Division, where two individuals on a motorcycle opened fire at a person outside the residence and later inside the house.

title: Sri Lankan tea exports revenue reach 1.43 billion USD in 2024
byline: Sri Lanka earned 1.43 billion U.S. dollars from tea exports in 2024, with an increase of more than 9 percent year-on-year, state media reported on Wednesday.

title: Three Israelis and five Thai hostages expected to be freed next by Hamas
byline: Three Israeli hostages and five Thai nationals are expected to be freed from Gaza by Hamas on Thursday, Israel has said.

title: Meta agrees to pay $25 million to settle lawsuit from Trump after Jan. 6 suspension
byline: Meta has agreed to pay $25 million to settle a lawsuit filed by President Donald Trump against the company after it suspended his accounts following the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol, according to three people familiar with the matter.

title: American Airlines jet collides with helicopter near Washington’s Reagan Airport
byline: An American Airlines regional passenger jet and a U.S. Army Black Hawk helicopter crashed into the Potomac River after a midair collision near Reagan Washington National Airport on Wednesday night, officials said.

title: MP Ramanathan Archchuna to step down from politics?
byline: Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna, who was granted bail, stated that he respects the law and has no intention of continuing in politics, expressing dissatisfaction with the political landscape.

title: Mercedes 1955 ‘streamliner’ set to smash F1 record at auction
byline: A sleek, long-nosed Mercedes raced by Stirling Moss and five-times Formula One world champion Juan Manuel Fangio in 1955 could become the most expensive grand prix car of all time at an auction in Stuttgart on Saturday.

title: Colombo hit with smog as air quality in Sri Lanka stabilizes
byline: The Air Quality Index (AQI) across Sri Lanka has returned to normal levels today (30), according to the media spokesperson for the Central Environmental Authority (CEA), Dr. Ajith Gunawardena.

title: 77th Independence Day celebrations to feature notable changes
byline: Arrangements have been made to hold the 77th Independence Day celebrations on February 4, at Independence Square in Colombo.

title: Lanka Sathosa slashes prices of several essential consumer goods
byline: In a move aimed at providing relief to the public, Lanka Sathosa has announced a reduction in the prices of several essential consumer goods.

title: Former Secretary of Public Administration arrested
byline: Former Secretary to the Ministry of Public Administration, Priyantha Mayadunne has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today (30), over alleged financial misappropriation.

title: Sri Lanka records over 200,000 tourist arrivals in January
byline: The number of tourists visiting Sri Lanka in January 2024 has surpassed 200,000, according to the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA).

title: Former Secretary of Public Administration granted bail
byline: Former Secretary to the Ministry of Public Administration, Priyantha Mayadunne who was arrested today (30) by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) over alleged financial misappropriation, has been granted bail by the Fort Magistrate’s Court.

title: 18 bodies pulled from Washington river after plane collides with helicopter
byline: A passenger jet carrying 64 people crashed into Washington’s Potomac River Wednesday after colliding midair with a military helicopter, with US media reporting multiple bodies pulled from the dark, near-freezing water.

title: Sri Lanka’s Joint Chambers and associations propose solutions for port congestion crisis
byline: In light of the ongoing challenges faced at the Colombo Port, Sri Lanka’s Joint Chambers, along with key trade, maritime and logistics associations, have proposed several short-term and medium-term solutions to mitigate the impact of port congestion on the nation’s economy.

title: Governor Hanif Yusoof files complaint with CID over ‘baseless’ allegations
byline: Western Province Governor Hanif Yusoof has filed a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) against the allegations leveled against him regarding the containers released from the Colombo Port without inspections.

title: Sri Lanka Customs launches four-day rapid container clearance process
byline: Sri Lanka Customs, with the full cooperation of joint trade unions, launched a four-day expedited container clearance process today (30) , aiming to clear the backlog of containers at examination yards by February 02, 2025.

title: Ex-President Ranil convenes special discussion; SJB MPs also attend
byline: A special political discussion was held this afternoon (30) under the patronage of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe at a private hotel in Colombo.

title: Everyone aboard American Airlines jet that collided with Army helicopter feared dead
byline: Everyone aboard an American Airlines jet carrying 60 passengers and four crew members that collided with an Army helicopter was feared dead in what was likely to be the worst U.S. aviation disaster in almost a quarter century, officials said Thursday.
